tweet_text: India has gifted 100,000 COVID-19 vaccines to Barbados, which arrived today. The Prime Minister of Barbados thanked Prime Minister Modi for his quick and generous action in providing the vaccines.

The person is waiting for their turn to get the COVID-19 vaccine and in the meantime, they are taking precautions such as wearing a mask, social distancing, avoiding crowds, and not gathering indoors with people they don't live with to slow the spread of the virus.
The speaker is hosting an event with the CEOs of Johnson & Johnson and Merck to discuss their partnership to produce more COVID-19 vaccines. The event can be watched online.
The message urges people to wear masks, maintain social distancing, and avoid crowds to slow the spread of COVID-19 and help small businesses stay open until enough people get vaccinated.
President Kagame and First Lady Jeannette Kagame received their COVID-19 vaccines at King Faisal Hospital as part of the nationwide vaccination rollout that has seen over 230,000 people vaccinated.
Rwanda has received 50,000 doses of Covid-19 vaccines from India and expressed gratitude to the Indian government and other partner countries for their contribution to the fight against the pandemic.
The UP-PGH COVID-19 Groups provide information on the Astrazeneca and SinoVac COVID-19 vaccines.
Four former US presidents have appeared in two national ad campaigns to promote trust in COVID-19 vaccines. The campaigns feature photos of the former presidents getting vaccinated against the virus.
The author believes that America is strongest when people work together for a common cause, and with the development of safe and effective COVID-19 vaccines, there is an opportunity to do so again.

An op-ed written by a Yale MSTP student and a professor aims to dispel myths and provide facts about COVID-19 vaccines for pregnant and nursing women. The authors argue that misinformation and fear-mongering have led to confusion and hesitancy among this population, despite evidence showing the safety and efficacy of the vaccines. They urge healthcare providers to educate their patients and encourage vaccination to protect both mother and baby.
Dr. Anthony Fauci, chief medical advisor to the President and director of @NIAIDNews, will be answering questions about COVID-19 and the science behind the vaccines for the next hour.
The author urges mothers not to allow their babies to receive the experimental COVID-19 vaccines.

Russia's intelligence services, including SVR, FSB, and GRU, used fake news sites and social media accounts to spread misinformation about Pfizer and Moderna vaccines in an effort to undermine public confidence in them, according to the Wall Street Journal.

Joel Embiid, a basketball player, will donate his $100,000 earnings from the All-Star Weekend to three homeless shelters in Philadelphia to provide meals, clothing items, treatment and care for those who get COVID-19 vaccines, funds for a summer camp, shelter for over 300 teens, and support for formerly homeless families.

President Biden is urging states to provide COVID-19 vaccines to teachers, school staff, and child care workers by the end of March. The federal retail pharmacy program will prioritize their vaccinations, and a list of participating pharmacies can be found online.
The author's Twitter account and others were blocked after tweeting about Bill Gates' refusal to support dropping patents on Covid-19 vaccines. The author had asked Gates about the issue personally.
The person is tired of people comparing different COVID-19 vaccines and is willing to take any vaccine, even if it's manufactured by Frito-Lay, just to be able to see other people again.

The Fitzhenry Vector Lab at McMaster University's Global Nexus for Pandemics and Biological Threats is being proposed as a potential site for producing COVID-19 vaccines for all Canadians. The lab has the necessary infrastructure and expertise to produce vaccines and reduce Canada's reliance on international partners. Action can be taken now to ensure Canada's vaccine production capabilities.

NASA's Perseverance rover carried a commemorative plate to Mars in gratitude to the medical community for their efforts during the COVID-19 pandemic. The plate expresses thanks to the researchers who developed vaccines.

The author is calling on Florida Governor Ron DeSantis to offer COVID-19 vaccines to all teachers, agriculture and food workers, and other essential employees, as the supply is available and it could save lives.

The article reports that 23 people in Norway have died after receiving the COVID-19 vaccine. The author suggests that those who claim vaccines are 100% safe and ridicule anti-vaxxers will now have to rely on those who question the safety of vaccines to promote widespread vaccination.

The authors of the article demand that the European Medicines Agency (EMA) withdraw approval for gene-based vaccines until all safety concerns have been properly addressed and evidence is made available. They argue that the vaccines may have long-term effects on fertility, pregnancy, and the immune system, and that the EMA has not exercised due diligence in assessing these risks.
Starting April 5, all Michigan residents aged 16 and above will be eligible to receive a COVID-19 vaccine. The governor urges all eligible individuals to get vaccinated.
The EU and Italy have blocked AstraZeneca's COVID-19 vaccine shipment to Australia due to the drug manufacturer's failure to deliver the doses it promised to Europe.

The team at OSUWexMed administered some of the first Johnson & Johnson COVID-19 vaccines, which is the only single-dose shot authorized by the FDA. They are working to increase its production to vaccinate more people quickly.

The article discusses the potential for individuals who have been vaccinated against COVID-19 to still be asymptomatic carriers of the virus and why masks are still necessary for a period of time. The article explains that while vaccines are highly effective at preventing severe illness and hospitalization, they may not completely prevent transmission of the virus. As a result, individuals who have been vaccinated may still be able to spread the virus to others, particularly those who have not yet been vaccinated. Therefore, masks are still necessary to help prevent the spread of the virus until a larger portion of the population has been vaccinated.

North Carolina has been ranked as the top state in the US for vaccinating adults over 65. The state's vaccine providers and the team at NCDHHS have been praised for their hard work in ensuring vaccines are distributed quickly and equitably.
The three authorized vaccines in the U.S. greatly reduce the risk of getting Covid-19 and have high efficacy against serious outcomes like hospitalization and death.

Dr. Anthony Fauci urges Republicans who are hesitant about Covid-19 vaccines to follow former President Trump's lead and get vaccinated, citing that Trump's vaccination shows his belief in the effectiveness of the vaccine.
Simulations have shown that vaccinating people sooner with a lower efficacy vaccine can prevent more Covid-19 cases, hospitalizations, and deaths compared to waiting for a higher efficacy vaccine.

The Navajo Nation has exceeded its target of administering 100,000 COVID-19 vaccines by the end of February, which is more than half of its population. The increase in vaccine supply, vaccination locations, and vaccinators has contributed to this achievement.
As Covid-19 vaccines are being distributed across the U.S., there are concerns about what happens to extra doses left unused at the end of the day and who might have access to them.

The Bronx Delegation, including federal, state, and city officials, have written a letter to Governor Cuomo requesting more vaccines for the Bronx, which has been the hardest hit borough in New York City by COVID-19. They emphasize the importance of vaccine equity.
CVS has expanded its Covid-19 vaccination program to 29 states and Puerto Rico through Biden's federal retail pharmacy program.

The tweet encourages religious people to support COVID-19 vaccines and not let fundamentalists define the religious view on vaccines. It asks for retweets from those who support both religion and vaccines.

A group of scientists and doctors have written an open letter to the European Medicines Agency (EMA) asking for urgent safety questions regarding the COVID-19 vaccine to be answered or for the authorization of the vaccine to be withdrawn. The letter was accompanied by a video by Dr. Bhakdi.

GP Dr. F Hussain is calling every patient from her surgery who has not yet accepted their COVID vaccine in an effort to drive out hesitancy and increase vaccination rates. This is part of the NHS's battle against vaccine hesitancy.
The Secretary visited servicewomen and men administering COVID-19 vaccines on the USS Essex and emphasized the importance of the military's involvement in the COVID-19 solution.

Immunologist Zhou Xing explains the workings of the 2nd-gen COVID-19 vaccines developed by MacGlobalNexus, how researchers mobilized quickly to develop them, and why an inhaled vaccine is being created instead of an injected one.
Alaska has become the first state to allow anyone 16 or older who lives or works in the state to get a Covid-19 vaccine, without any eligibility requirements, according to Governor Dunleavy.

The tweet announces a partnership between Presidents Obama, Bush, and Carter with Ad Council and The Covid Collaborative to inform Americans about COVID-19 vaccines. The tweet provides a link for more information.

An op-ed in The Washington Post co-written by Walter Kim of the National Association of Evangelicals and bioethicist Matthew Lee Anderson argues that Christians should not be afraid of the COVID-19 vaccines, as they are both ethical and safe. The authors address concerns about the use of fetal cell lines in vaccine development and emphasize the importance of protecting vulnerable populations through vaccination.

The US has banned all vaccine exports, but the UK media has not commented much as they have not exported much and have priority access to the AstraZeneca vaccine. However, when the EU stopped one order to a Covid-free country out of the 20 countries they exported vaccines to, the UK media criticized the EU for letting the whole world die, despite being on the verge of collapse.

President Biden announced that all adults will be eligible for the Covid-19 vaccine by May 1. The author humorously wishes for a one-shot vaccine and one-shot tequila for their upcoming birthday on Cinco de Mayo.

Moody's has revised its projection for India's growth in FY2022 to 13.7%, up from the earlier estimate of 10.8%, citing the normalization of activity and growing confidence in the market with the rollout of Covid-19 vaccines.

A new drive-thru vaccination site has been announced in Sumterville, Florida, which will provide 3,000 Johnson & Johnson vaccines to Floridians aged 65 and older over the next three days. The announcement was made with a focus on prioritizing seniors.
The EU has secured an agreement with BioNTech-Pfizer for the supply of four million more doses of COVID-19 vaccines in the next two weeks to address hotspots and facilitate free border movement.

The author hopes that Nigerian officials will distribute the COVID-19 vaccine according to international standards, prioritizing medical workers and elderly individuals. They also urge officials not to distribute the vaccine to family, friends, or associates.

Elvis Presley's vaccination at the Ed Sullivan Show in 1956 inspired thousands to get the polio vaccine, and now three former US presidents are considering getting vaccinated publicly to encourage Americans to do the same for COVID-19.

India has sent over 481 lakh doses of Covid vaccines to different countries as of March 4. Out of these, 73.5 lakh doses were provided as grant assistance, 288.4 lakh doses were sent on a commercial basis, and 119.16 lakh doses were sent for COVAX.

The decision to publish a story about single doses of COVID-19 vaccines being enough for now is deemed despicable and reckless by the author. The article was published by the Toronto Star and the source is Ottawa.

The CDC is urging people to get vaccinated with the first vaccine offered to them, including the new Johnson & Johnson COVID-19 vaccine. They provide information on their website about what to know before getting vaccinated.
Whoopi Goldberg received her first shot of the COVID-19 vaccine and encourages others to do the same. She urges people to "get the shot" and provides a link for more information on COVID-19 vaccines.
Vaccines are highly effective against severe Covid illness and death, but they are not perfect, so it is still important to wear masks.

The development of vaccines for COVID-19 was not solely due to Trump, as there were various factors that contributed to their quick development, such as previous research on AIDS and Ebola, the work of scientists like Katalin Karikó and Kizzy Corbett, and the establishment of the Vaccine Research Center under Clinton and Obama.
Russian intelligence agencies are attempting to erode trust in Western vaccines, including Pfizer's, through a propaganda campaign.

A survey has revealed the extent of damage to the perceived safety of the AstraZeneca vaccine in Europe, with 27% of Germans, 22% of French, 23% of Italians, and 19% of Spaniards saying they would refuse this vaccine and wait for a different one. In contrast, only 2% of Britons said they would refuse the AstraZeneca vaccine. The survey also showed that the Pfizer and Moderna vaccines were more widely accepted across all countries surveyed.

Radiologists are reporting unusual swelling caused by Covid-19 vaccines being picked up on routine mammograms and other scans, causing unnecessary worries about breast and other forms of cancer. To avoid such worries, individuals can schedule their mammograms before their vaccine or wait four to six weeks after their vaccine to get their mammogram.
The author has created a guide on scheduling Covid vaccines on the NYC and NY State websites and hopes it will be helpful. They welcome suggestions for improving the tips.

Russia is targeting Q-Anon believers with a disinformation campaign aimed at undermining confidence in Covid-19 vaccines, according to security analyst Malcolm Nance. The campaign highlights the importance of accuracy and truth in countering disinformation.

Uganda has received its first batch of 864,000 doses of AstraZeneca COVID-19 vaccines through the COVAX facility. The vaccines were manufactured by the Serum Institute of India. The country expressed gratitude to all those who made this possible.
CVS Health will be administering COVID-19 vaccines at 76 additional pharmacy locations in Florida, bringing the total number of CVS vaccination locations in the state to 157 in 30 counties.
All phase 3 priority groups are now eligible for COVID-19 vaccines as the supply increases and three vaccines are available. New appointments will be posted at midnight.

At the current global vaccination rate of 6,582,835 doses per day, it will take approximately 4.7 years to vaccinate 75% of the population with a two-dose vaccine. This inequality is widening, and low- and middle-income countries need access to the COVID-19 vaccine faster.
The tweet highlights the contributions of extraordinary women in the development and deployment of COVID-19 vaccines, in honor of International Women's Day.

The article discusses the concerns of medical racism and the experimental Covid-19 vaccines in the Black community. It warns Black Americans to be cautious and informed about the potential risks and to demand transparency and accountability from the medical industry. The article also highlights the history of medical experimentation on Black people and the need for Black voices to be included in the decision-making process.

The author encountered only one person who refused the vaccine while out on the street last week, with the rest having questions or trying to figure out how to get it. The author shares their perspective on vaccine acceptance.

Alaska has become the first state in the US to make COVID-19 vaccines available to anyone aged 16 and older, removing eligibility requirements.

Former President George W. Bush and his wife Laura have received the COVID-19 vaccine and are encouraging others to do the same when it is their turn. They believe that the vaccines are safe and effective and are the way out of the pandemic towards recovery and renewal.

The FBI and its partners are warning the public about vaccine-related fraud schemes as states distribute COVID-19 vaccines. They advise people to protect their financial and personal information from fraudsters by visiting a website for more information.

The Coordinating Bureau of the Non-Aligned Movement has issued a communique calling for affordable, timely, equitable, and universal access to COVID-19 vaccines for all countries. The statement emphasizes the need for international cooperation and solidarity to ensure that developing countries are not left behind in the global vaccination effort.

The spread of Covid-19 globally increases the likelihood of mutations that are more infectious, deadly, and resistant to vaccines. To end the pandemic, the Biden administration must take bold steps to increase global vaccine access, according to Senator Booker.

The authors argue that while vaccines are a crucial tool in ending the pandemic, testing remains essential to identify and contain outbreaks, monitor vaccine effectiveness, and track new variants. They also highlight the need for equitable distribution of vaccines and testing resources to ensure that vulnerable populations are not left behind.

The tweet provides links to a COVID-19 vaccine pre-registration survey and a page with next steps, FAQs, and quick facts for those who complete the survey.

The article discusses a conversation with Peter Hotez about the political aspects of the response to Covid-19 and the introduction of vaccines in Texas and beyond. The article highlights the ongoing fight in Texas and the challenges faced in the introduction of vaccines.
Data from the MHRA shows that vaccines are safe with mild side effects that go away within a few days. More information on vaccines can be found at the provided link.

The Lancet has identified four major challenges in ensuring global access to COVID-19 vaccines: production, affordability, allocation, and deployment. The article highlights the need for increased production capacity, fair pricing, equitable distribution, and effective deployment strategies to ensure that all countries have access to vaccines.

Bahrain is offering COVID-19 vaccines to F1 personnel ahead of preseason testing and the season opener, and drivers Sergio Perez and Carlos Sainz have chosen to get inoculated. Six F1 drivers, or 30% of the starting grid, contracted COVID-19 last season.
As of Thursday morning, the United States has administered over 98 million doses of COVID-19 vaccines and distributed over 131 million doses.
Over 200,000 doses of the COVID-19 vaccine have been administered in Northern Virginia, accounting for 1/3 of all shots given in the region and 1 in every 11 administered in Virginia.
The World Bank has approved $500 million in funding to help the Philippines purchase and distribute COVID-19 vaccines, improve their health systems, and support those most affected by the pandemic.

Today marks the one-year anniversary of the WHO declaring the coronavirus a global pandemic. With the rollout of COVID-19 vaccines and a decrease in new cases, there is hope for a return to a new normal. More information will be provided at 6:30 p.m. ET.
The UK Government is offering vaccines to rough sleepers and homeless people, following in the footsteps of Wales.
Harvard Chan's Bill Hanage and Wayne Koff discuss COVID-19 vaccines and preventing the next pandemic in an interview with CBC.
Tennessee residents now have three safe and effective COVID-19 vaccines to choose from and can learn how to select the best one for themselves.

Michelle Liang, a pharmacist, reflects on giving over 1,000 flu shots and looks forward to playing a role in providing COVID-19 vaccines. She believes that pharmacy is an essential piece in Canada's health-care system.
The Vaccines Minister and London's chief nurse participated in an online Covid-19 vaccination Q&A with hundreds of viewers and a range of questions. The session can be watched again online.

Top Cambodian leaders, including the President of the National Assembly and the President of the Senate, have received the first shot of the CoviShield COVID-19 vaccine as part of the Vaccine Maitri initiative.

A study by the UN Development Program and Unicef has found that Ukraine is experiencing an "infodemic" with false narratives about the virus and vaccines flooding social media. This has led to vaccine hesitancy, which is among the worst in Europe, even among medics.

Children living in war zones are being severely impacted by the COVID-19 pandemic and are unlikely to have access to vaccines in the near future. A petition is being circulated to advocate for equal access to vaccines for all.

A pop-up COVID vaccination clinic for people with learning disabilities is being run by a partnership between East Kent Mencap and KCHFT. The clinic will provide extra time for each patient and any necessary support to ensure the vaccine is rolled out effectively.

Invitations for Covid-19 vaccination are being sent to people aged 56 to 59. The vaccines are safe and effective, and those who are eligible but have not yet been vaccinated can book an appointment online or by calling 119.

Utah's Lt. Governor, Deidre Henderson, announced the Striving Towards Equity plan for distributing COVID-19 vaccines in a fair and equitable manner. More information can be found at the provided website.
Phase 1C will become eligible for COVID-19 vaccines from March 15, according to breaking news.

Access to COVID-19 vaccines is determined by geographical location, leaving millions of people at the back of the line. Mercy Corps believes that vaccines should be accessible to everyone, regardless of location.

Dr. B Founder Cyrus Massoumi has developed a system for matching people with leftover COVID-19 vaccines. Vaccine providers simply need to indicate how many doses they have and when they expire, and Dr. B Founder's system will message patients until every single dose is spoken for.

Walmart is providing COVID-19 vaccines for eligible residents in East Baton Rouge Parish at two locations. Insurance is not required and the vaccines will be given at no cost. Appointments are necessary and can be made through a provided link.

WBTV has launched a new podcast called "Good Question" which will feature experts answering questions about various topics. The first episode focuses on allergies and COVID-19 vaccines and features Alex Giles, Jamie Boll, and WBTV producer Jess Dyer. The podcast will be released weekly.

The speaker and her husband received their first dose of the Oxford-AstraZeneca COVID-19 vaccine from the Federal Government, along with some frontline workers. The speaker commended the bravery and hard work of these workers.
Black residents in Miami express both concerns and confidence in COVID-19 vaccines.

The recommended interval for COVID-19 vaccines should be used, while the minimum interval should only be used in exceptional circumstances, according to a table provided in a tweet. The tweet also includes hashtags for CovidVaccine and HoldFirm.
Ontario will release a list of 380 pharmacies offering AstraZeneca COVID-19 vaccines for adults aged 60 to 64, with vaccinations starting this week in Toronto, Windsor, and Kingston.
Over 40 districts in Uganda have received COVID-19 vaccines, with the number expected to increase to 55 by the end of the day, according to the Ministry of Health.

The Provincial Incident Management Team and Negros Occidental COVID-19 Vaccination Task Force have received 1,600 doses of Sinovac vaccines for storage at the Provincial Health Office cold room on March 10.
Ogun State Governor Dapo Abiodun and his Deputy, Engr Noimot Salako-Oyedele, along with other members of the Ogun State Executive Council, have been vaccinated with the AstraZeneca COVID-19 vaccine.
Mexico's Foreign Relations Secretary Marcelo Ebrard has announced that the country will purchase up to 22 million doses of Chinese COVID-19 vaccines from Sinovac and Sinopharm.
UNICEF is partnering with the Fijian government under the COVAX initiative to support the preparation and delivery of COVID-19 vaccines in Fiji as the country begins its vaccination roll-out.
The TRIPS waiver aims to provide fair access to COVID-19 treatments and vaccines for everyone, which can help speed up the end of the pandemic.

Researchers will be checking immune responses to the COVID vaccine at Royal Glamorgan hospital tomorrow. The study will take place from 9am to 1pm at the new Clinical Research Centre. The researchers are encouraging people to share the information and come find them.
The ICIR examines the contentious claims made by conspiracy theorists regarding the COVID-19 outbreak and the vaccines developed to combat it.
The East Africa Law Society is hosting a webinar in partnership with SADCLA to discuss the impact of COVID-19 on health rights, including access to vaccines.

The Ondo State government has received doses of the Oxford-AstraZeneca COVID-19 vaccine from the Federal Government. The vaccine was delivered through Akure Airport and received by officials of the state Primary Health Care Development Agency on behalf of the government.

New York is expanding its COVID-19 vaccine eligibility to include individuals age 60 and above, starting at 8 a.m. on Wednesday. This expands the previous eligibility age of 65+. Governor Andrew Cuomo made the announcement.

Cal Poly has established priority groups for employee access to COVID-19 vaccines, with input from stakeholders and endorsement from SLO Public Health. Employees are encouraged to stay informed and take action when it is their turn to receive the vaccine. The priority groups are listed on the provided link.

A panel of expert Black medical scientists will discuss the development of COVID-19 vaccines, how they work with the immune system, and the issues that Black communities need to consider. Interested individuals can sign up to join the discussion.

A video has been added to a YouTube channel discussing arthritis, COVID-19, and vaccines. The video features rheumatologist members of a Medical Advisory Committee answering questions from patients. The discussion is moderated by someone named TO_dpr.

The tweet expresses pride in the work of Secure Democracy on exposing Russian, Chinese, and Iranian manipulation of information about COVID-19 vaccines. The work has been recognized by various media outlets, including the White House, WSJ, Stephen Colbert, and RT. A link to an article about the work is included in the tweet.

The COVID-19 pandemic has highlighted the importance of open access in scientific research, as researchers work to understand the disease and develop vaccines. Open access allows for greater collaboration and sharing of information, which is crucial in the fight against the pandemic.

The Red Cross Red Crescent Global Migration Lab has released a report highlighting an "invisible wall" preventing migrants from accessing essential services and vaccines during the COVID-19 pandemic. The report calls for urgent action to address the issue.

Starting March 17, the City of Toronto's vaccination clinics at the Metro Toronto Convention Centre, Scarborough Town Centre, and Toronto Congress Centre will be open to vaccinate individuals aged 80 and older. More information about COVID-19 vaccines in Toronto can be found at the provided link.

The GP discussed Covid vaccines with the patient and informed them that their practice will receive 50 doses of the vaccine per week starting in April. The government has stated that everyone will be inoculated by October, but did not specify which year.
DrakeCPHS students have distributed over 4,000 COVID-19 vaccines to eligible Polk County residents on campus.
The CDC has released guidance that provides another reason to be excited about COVID-19 vaccines and encourages people to get vaccinated as soon as possible.

The article provides an explanation of Covid-19 vaccines and vaccination, including the different types of vaccines, how they work, and the importance of vaccination in controlling the spread of the virus. It also addresses common concerns and misconceptions about vaccines and emphasizes the safety and effectiveness of approved vaccines. The article is shared by the World Health Organization (WHO) and its regional offices.

Some of San Francisco's hardest hit neighborhoods were not included in California's COVID-19 vaccine equity plan, with only two zip codes, the Tenderloin and Treasure Island, represented by Supervisor Matt Haney.
CVS is offering Covid vaccines in certain states with available appointments, even if local vaccination sites are full or have long lines.

Chief of Staff to the President, Professor Ibrahim Gambari, Special Adviser to the Pres. on Media and Publicity, Femi Adesina, SSA (Media and Publicity), Garba Shehu, and other Presidential aides received COVID-19 vaccines at the State House Clinic Abuja.

Vanden Bossche explains that pathogen-specific antibodies have a stronger affinity for the virus and can easily outcompete our natural antibodies for binding to the virus. This ties in with COVID-19 vaccines.

The COVID-19 vaccine efforts in Alaska are being seen as a historic moment that will be talked about for years to come, according to a statement from an Alaskan official. The title of the article, "Race Against Time and History," reflects the urgency and significance of the vaccine rollout.

The VA VACCINE Act expands the Department of Veterans Affairs' ability to distribute the COVID-19 vaccine to all veterans, regardless of their enrollment status or eligibility for VA healthcare services. The act is supported by Chairman Mark Takano and Ranking Member Bost.

As of 1pm on March 8th, there are 3,172 active cases and 276,528 confirmed cases of Covid-19 in the Western Cape. There have been 262,106 recoveries. By 5pm on March 5th, 17,568 vaccines had been administered.
The tweet invites people to reflect on how the COVID-19 pandemic has affected them over the past year and share their views on the COVID-19 vaccines. A link to an article is provided.
The funder hired a good press secretary, acknowledged the COVID-19 deaths, increased vaccine production, rejoined the Paris Climate Accord, and prioritized transparency in the White House.

Maryland's governor announced that the state has broken a record for administering vaccines. The article provides an update on the current status of the fight against COVID-19 in Washington D.C., Maryland, and Virginia.

It is still important to get tested for COVID-19 even with the distribution of vaccines underway. People are encouraged to schedule an appointment to stop the spread of the virus. A link is provided for scheduling appointments.

The article provides answers to frequently asked questions about COVID-19 vaccines for individuals diagnosed with prostate cancer. It aims to provide useful information to those who may have concerns or questions about the vaccines.

China has developed technological advantages in two vaccine roadmaps, recombinant subunit vaccines and adenovirus vector vaccines, according to Chen Wei, a member of CPPCC who led the team that developed China's first one-dose COVID-19 vaccine.
Dr Spurrier, from @SAHealth, has been praised for keeping South Australia free of the virus, but her statement on vaccines being equally effective and safe is disappointing to some.
There are four Covid-19 vaccines that are all 100% effective at preventing hospitalization and death.
The de Young Museum in San Francisco is reopening in March with a Pablo Picasso painting exhibition as COVID-19 restrictions ease and vaccines are distributed.

The author walked through neighborhoods affected by Covid-19 and shared information about free vaccine opportunities on March 13 through a flyer. They also encouraged others to spread the word to friends and family.
Mercy Philadelphia and Penn Medicine have partnered with the West Philadelphia Faith Community to provide COVID-19 vaccines. Photos of the event were taken by HughE_Dillon.
The effectiveness of Covid-19 vaccines is based on the clinical trials that produced them, which were conducted differently, so their efficacy levels may vary.
COVID-19 vaccines are being held to the same safety standards as any other vaccine and have undergone intensive safety monitoring. Ongoing research will continue to ensure their safety.

The person will only accept to get vaccinated after vaccines for malaria have been discovered and produced with the same speed as Covid-19 vaccines. They support Governor Yahaya Bello's stance against Covid-19 vaccines.
A video claiming that mRNA vaccines revise DNA is incorrect, according to fact-checkers.
Catholics and those who value a culture of life can use vaccines without fear of moral culpability, according to a statement.

The Lancet Infectious Diseases editor, John S. McConnell, answers frequently asked questions about the COVID-19 vaccine in a video series. Viewers can learn more about the vaccine and its efficacy from the expert.
The tweet provides a link to a list of COVID-19 vaccine locations that are currently accepting appointments, which can be filtered by parish.
A consignment of Covid-19 vaccines made in India has been airlifted to Guyana, Jamaica, and Nicaragua as part of the country's "Vaccine Maitri" initiative.

COVID-19 advice should be both hopeful and realistic, and should emphasize the benefits of vaccines in allowing for less restrictions. This approach can help encourage more people to get vaccinated and ultimately lead to a faster end to the pandemic.

An op-ed by Virginia Sole-Smith discusses the complexities of including BMI as a qualifying factor for COVID-19 vaccines in New York, as it may perpetuate weight stigma and discrimination. While obesity is a risk factor for severe COVID-19, it is not a direct cause and should not be used as a sole determinant for vaccine eligibility. The author suggests a more nuanced approach that takes into account individual health histories and comorbidities.

The article provides tips for staying informed about the COVID-19 vaccine and dispelling myths surrounding it. It encourages individuals to seek accurate information and share it with others to promote understanding and acceptance of the vaccine.

A webinar titled "Equitable Distribution of Vaccines for COVID-19" featuring four experts will take place on March 10. The experts are IDEpiPhD, e_hernandez8, MCarnethon, and clt1020. Interested individuals can register for the event using the provided link.

Irish Minister Simon Harris has praised the efforts of scientists and researchers in developing safe and effective Covid-19 vaccines, stating that there is hope on the horizon thanks to their work. He made the comments at the launch of Science Foundation Ireland's new strategy.

The tweet gives a shoutout to Dr. Ala Stanford for founding the Black Doctors COVID-19 Consortium to provide testing and vaccines to Black and Brown people in Philadelphia. The tweet emphasizes that Black History never stops happening.

The Global Times reports that there have been 16 deaths in Switzerland following the administration of mRNA vaccines from Pfizer and Moderna, raising concerns about the safety of these vaccines for the elderly. The article suggests that the US media is not reporting on these deaths.
Coastal Cloud and CDR Health have started supporting six more COVID-19 vaccine sites in Florida to reach communities facing access challenges. The system has administered 305,000 vaccines to date.

CANVAS Network is conducting a national study to monitor the safety of COVID-19 vaccines in Canada. Both vaccinated and unvaccinated Canadians can enroll in the study. More information is available at https://t.co/ehjbEq5he1.

The fair and equitable distribution of COVID-19 vaccines is important for promoting social and health equity, reducing disparities in Europe, and protecting public health. The European Public Health Alliance offers resources on vaccine equity.

The Pfizer and Moderna COVID-19 vaccines require two doses for maximum effectiveness, according to patient information provided by JAMA Network. The second dose is necessary to provide a stronger and longer-lasting immune response to the virus. It is important for patients to receive both doses as recommended by their healthcare provider.

@OttawaYBP and @blackottconnect are hosting an event for Black community members to learn about COVID-19, the COVID-19 vaccines, and ways to stay healthy during the pandemic from Black medical professionals.

The author joined ChicagoCares and the #ProtectChicago Plus initiative to textbank and share information about COVID-19 vaccines for communities most impacted by the pandemic. They encourage anyone who needs help to visit a website for more information.

Dr. Susan Lopez from IMPACT4HC is advising community members about vaccines and addressing concerns about safety to encourage more people to get vaccinated quickly. She is joined by WF Parker and Alison Buttenheim.

The Covid vaccine is safe and effective, and people should get it if offered. Healthcare professionals can provide guidance and answer questions. The Chief Pharmacist, Sumithra Maheswaran, explains the importance of getting vaccinated.

A new strategy for randomized COVID-19 vaccination rollout has been proposed by researchers. The strategy aims to generate direct real-world evidence and obtain knowledge on the safety and efficacy of COVID-19 vaccines. The approach can be rapidly embedded and would provide otherwise unobtainable information.

The NHS has warned of an email scam claiming to offer private COVID-19 vaccines for purchase in the UK. The NHS has clarified that vaccines cannot be bought privately and that any correspondence regarding the vaccine will come from the individual's health board. The NHS advises individuals not to share any personal information and assures that the vaccine will be free.

Johnson & Johnson's COVID-19 vaccine can be stored at normal refrigeration temperatures, making it easier to distribute. Veterinarians are now approved to administer COVID-19 vaccines, which could open the door for horse hospitals to participate in vaccination efforts.
Navy pharmacists Lt. Courtney Corcoran and Lt. Cmdr. Ebenezer Aniagyei are preparing COVID-19 vaccines at a state-run, federally-supported Community Vaccination Center in Paterson, New Jersey.

Prof. Markus Covert from Stanford Engineering discusses the development of COVID-19 vaccines, from the long process of research and clinical trials to the short time frame in which they were developed and approved. He emphasizes the importance of collaboration and innovation in the scientific community, as well as the need for continued research to address new variants of the virus.

The Ad26.COV2.S vaccine developed by Janssen (J&J) has been listed by the World Health Organization (WHO) for emergency use in all countries and for COVAX roll-out, making it the fourth vaccine to receive such approval. The Pfizer/BioNTech, Astrazeneca-SK Bio, and Serum Institute of India vaccines are also listed for emergency use.

The tweet encourages people to spread factual information about COVID-19 vaccines and provides resources for more information. It also includes a link to make a vaccine appointment and urges the community to get educated and vaccinated.
The Covid vaccine has undergone rigorous clinical trials and safety tests before being made available to the public, meeting the same criteria as every other vaccine approved for use in the UK.
Penn Medicine has administered over 62,000 doses of the COVID-19 vaccine in just five weeks, despite logistical challenges and vaccine hesitancy.
Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau and federal officials are holding a live discussion about the country's response to COVID-19 and the distribution of vaccines.

The article provides an update on the rollout of COVID-19 vaccines in Canadian long-term care homes and offers resources to support community and institutional long-term care responses to the pandemic.

The New York Times published a graph last week showing the vaccine rollout and vaccinations in Black communities, which have been hit hardest by Covid-19 but are receiving a disproportionately smaller share of vaccines. Maryland is last in the difference between the Black share of the population and the percentage vaccinated.

The article suggests that the death totals for past pandemics were exaggerated and that vaccines were available. It also states that COVID-19 is worse in the US and that lockdowns were a logical response, but does not provide a clear connection between lockdowns and virus control.
The blog series on Covid-19 discusses vaccines and how they train the body to fight the virus. The article was written with the help of the author and is available to read.
The tweet urges Canadians to file complaints against physicians and lawyers who spread misinformation about COVID-19 and vaccines on social media platforms.
The author expresses gratitude and admiration for the scientists and researchers who developed the COVID-19 vaccines, including Katalin Karikó, who has been working towards this goal for decades.
President Biden called for unity in the fight against COVID-19 and encouraged Americans to continue taking precautions while the administration works to increase vaccine availability.
On the one-year anniversary of the COVID-19 pandemic, it has been revealed that vaccine access is inequitable, with less than 5% of COVAX vaccines going to those most at risk in low-income countries.

During a debate about COVID-19 vaccines in a space, one speaker who identified as Nigerian and based in Egypt was told to leave the group by another participant who said she did not experience the same level of suffering.

Four former presidents have come together to share an important message about the COVID-19 vaccines in a video released by the Ad Council and The COVID Collaborative. The message encourages Americans to get vaccinated and emphasizes the safety and effectiveness of the vaccines.

Health Canada has approved new COVID-19 vaccines that are safe and effective in preventing severe symptomatic infections and hospitalization. More information about the vaccines can be found at a provided link.

Young volunteers in Rwanda are working to combat COVID-19 misinformation and promote safety measures. With the arrival of the first COVAX vaccines in the country, their work has become even more important. Justine is one of these volunteers, and her journey is highlighted in the article.
Governor Tom Wolf denied that Bucks, Chester, Delaware, and Montgomery Counties have been shortchanged vaccines.

UK healthcare professionals are invited to join an expert panel discussion on COVID-19 vaccines and variants and their implications for IMID patients and services. The event will take place on March 17, 2021, and CPD accreditation has been applied for. Interested individuals can register through the provided link.

Seven European countries have suspended the use of AstraZeneca vaccines from a 1 million doses batch sent to 17 European countries over concerns relating to blood clots. The countries are Denmark, Norway, Austria, Estonia, Latvia, Lithuania, and Luxembourg.

The WHO declared a global pandemic a year ago and millions have died since then. Vaccines are the only way to defeat COVID-19, but many poorer nations have not received any doses yet. Knowledge must be shared to increase manufacturing and distribution as soon as possible.
British Columbia is opening up phone lines for people aged 85-89 to book appointments for COVID-19 vaccines. The phone lines will open on Thursday at noon.

The Australian Health Practitioner Regulation Agency (AHPRA) and National Boards have released a joint position statement outlining expectations for nurses and midwives regarding COVID-19 vaccines. The statement covers receiving, administering, and sharing information about the vaccines.

Family doctors in Ontario will begin administering COVID-19 vaccines on Friday, according to an announcement welcomed by the Ontario Medical Association. The details released will help doctors plan and provide the best care for their patients.

A session on COVID-disparities at #CROI2021 highlighted three things that can be done to address the issue: 1) Universal health care; 2) Community delivering messages about COVID-19 policies and vaccines; and 3) Decarceration.

Vaccines still work against variants of COVID-19, according to a sports analogy by @jeremyfaust. He compared it to making Serena Williams 50% less effective, but she would still be able to beat everyone else.

The COVID-19 vaccine is safe, effective, and free, and the same safety measures used for all vaccines were used for this one. People should trust the facts and get vaccinated. More information is available at a provided link.

The podcast discusses the misconception that COVID-19 vaccines are the mark of the beast and dismisses it. The hosts also cover topics such as gene guns, GMOs, and space plants. They recommend following @SWFLVegMan and @BenLocwin.

The International Federation of Red Cross and Red Crescent Societies (IFRC) has warned of a "deadly gap" in global efforts to distribute COVID-19 vaccines and called for urgent funding to expand vaccination efforts into all communities. IFRC Secretary-General Francesco Rocca emphasized the need for equitable distribution of vaccines to ensure that no one is left behind in the fight against the pandemic.
Governor Akeredolu and his deputy have received the Oxford-AstraZeneca COVID-19 vaccine in Ondo State, Nigeria. The state received 73,570 doses from the federal government.

UK Prime Minister Boris Johnson denies claims from European Council president Charles Michel that the UK has blocked the export of COVID-19 vaccines. Johnson states that the UK has not blocked the export of a single vaccine.

The latest episode of The FrancisFXPod features discussions on Pope Francis' visit to Iraq, the $1.9 trillion relief bill, and the problematic response of some bishops to COVID-19 vaccines. The podcast includes Francis X. Rocca, Heidi Schlumpf, and Daulton Gatto.

The podcast episode discusses the concept of Vaccine Nationalism and its role in the distribution of Covid-19 vaccines. The speaker explains various measures taken to ensure fair distribution of vaccines.
Cancer Australia has released FAQs about COVID-19 vaccines for people affected by cancer. The advice for 16-17 year-olds with cancer is currently being clarified.

Zimbabwe's Information Minister, Mutsvangwa, announced that the Covid-19 vaccines approved for emergency use in the country are Sinopharm and Sinovac from China, Covaxin from India, and Sputnik-V from Russia. Companies can choose from this list to procure vaccines for their employees.

Private hospital medical frontliners in Valenzuela are receiving COVID-19 vaccines from the NTF and DOH today. The city is promoting the vaccination campaign with the hashtag #TayoNaLigtasNaValenzuela and #BakunadongValenzuelano.

Health care workers are administering COVID-19 vaccines at Cashman Field and the organization is proud to have them there. They are looking forward to seeing more lines like these on summer Saturdays.
ABC's Instagram Live will feature Dr. Jennifer Ashton and Dr. Onyema Ogbuagu to answer questions about COVID-19 vaccines. The event will take place at 3:30 ET.

The three COVID-19 vaccines currently available are effective in preventing serious illness, hospitalization, and death, with all three being 100% effective in preventing COVID-related deaths. Vaccine efficacy ratings can be misleading.
All Veterans enrolled and eligible for VA health care in Northeast Ohio can now schedule to receive their COVID-19 Vaccine regardless of age or pre-existing conditions.

The Council of Europe and the United Nations are working towards ensuring equitable access to Covid-19 vaccines for all migrants. They aim to address the challenges faced by migrants in accessing healthcare and vaccines, and to ensure that no one is left behind in the global vaccination effort.

Lagos State has received doses of the Oxford-AstraZeneca COVID-19 vaccines from the Federal Government. The Governor has urged citizens to continue following COVID-19 protocols such as wearing masks, washing hands, and social distancing.
The COVID-19 webpage provides information on testing, vaccines, and other related topics. It is regularly updated and includes a link to the COVID-19 FAQ page.

The least-affluent countries will need healthcare structures, routine immunization, cold chains to preserve vaccines, and timely testing in order to control Covid and any future viruses. Without these measures, controlling the spread of viruses will be impossible.

Four southeastern Pennsylvania counties are in a dispute with the Pennsylvania Department of Health over the distribution of COVID-19 vaccines. A potential showdown is looming as the counties seek a larger allotment of vaccines.

@adagreatlakes is hosting an online Special Session on Access to COVID-19 Vaccines on March 24th from 2:00 PM EDT - 3:30 PM EDT. The session will focus on issues and barriers for persons with disabilities. Interested individuals can register at the provided link. #ADA #COVID

A majority of Californians support legislation that would provide hazard pay to essential workers until they are able to receive COVID-19 vaccines, according to a recent survey. The proposed legislation would provide additional compensation to frontline workers who have continued to work during the pandemic.

A free webinar is being offered on March 11 to help caregivers of people with intellectual and developmental disabilities prepare for the COVID-19 vaccine. The goal is to provide information and support to ensure that individuals with IDD are prepared and able to receive the vaccine. Interested caregivers can sign up for the webinar through the provided link.

Kansas City's public transit system, RideKC Transit, is providing free transportation to Housing Authority of Kansas City residents to receive COVID-19 vaccines at Truman Medical Centers. This partnership aims to improve equity in vaccine access.
Toronto has launched a website and hotline for booking COVID-19 vaccines.

The three approved COVID-19 vaccines have been thoroughly tested and are safe and effective in preventing serious illness, hospitalization, and death. People should take the vaccine when it is their turn. More information can be found at the provided links.

Dr. Mohammad Sajadi from the Institute of Human Virology at the University of Maryland discusses his work on COVID-19 vaccine responses in a recent GVN Spotlight. He also touches on other aspects of the pandemic, including the importance of testing and the potential for new variants of the virus.

The Chickasaw Nation has announced that vaccines are available to teachers at any grade-level or education facility, including child care teachers, vocational instructors, university and college educators, and adult learning teachers.
The Current CBC provides a behind-the-scenes look at UHN's Vaccine Clinic with Matt Galloway, Kevin Smith, Emily Musing, and Team Vaccine. They discuss what to expect when getting the COVID vaccine.
Russian, Chinese, and Iranian accounts mentioned Pfizer's COVID-19 vaccine more frequently than Moderna and AstraZeneca combined, out of the three vaccines authorized by the European Commission.

The campaign "Between Us, About Us" aims to provide Black communities with information about COVID-19 vaccines. The campaign was developed by KFF and BC Against COVID, and the first video features wkamaubell. More information can be found at the provided website.
The author is impressed with the speed and effectiveness of the Covid vaccines, and did not expect to have access to a highly effective vaccine by summer.
Dr Vanden Bossche, a former employee of GAVI The Vaccine Alliance, is not an antivaxxer and acknowledges the competence of scientists who designed, developed, and manufactured COVID-19 vaccines.

The author spoke with President Cyril Ramaphosa about India and South Africa's efforts to combat COVID-19 domestically and internationally. India's ability to produce medicines and vaccines is aiding many countries, including those in Africa.

The Philippine General Hospital has started rolling out the Astrazeneca COVID-19 vaccine to healthcare workers without any media, VIPs, or military presence. The focus is solely on protecting healthcare workers through vaccination. The tweet emphasizes that health and vaccines should not be politicized.
Pakistan has requested for the Made in India Covid vaccine under the Global Alliance for Vaccines and Immunisation program.

Europe's adverse events reporting system for drugs and vaccines, EUDRA, has data for Covid vaccines, which shows that the Pfizer vaccine alone has 58,000 reports, including about 730 deaths, making it worse than the US data.

The campaign for the global decriminalization of homosexuality has been launched, Iran is weaker and isolated, North Korea is open to dialogue, China has been unveiled and confronted, Poland is in the Visa Waiver Program, Serbia and Kosovo are normalizing their economic relations, the USMCA and Abraham Accords are in effect, and vaccines for Covid-19 are being developed at warp speed.

Grocery chains have seen an $18 billion increase in profits during the pandemic, but most have stopped offering hero pay to their workers after just one month. Meanwhile, 29,000 grocery workers have contracted COVID-19 and 74% of them are not yet eligible for the vaccine. This treatment of essential workers as sacrificial is unacceptable.

Russian intelligence agencies are using online publications to spread misinformation and undermine confidence in Pfizer and other Covid vaccines, according to U.S. officials. These publications have questioned the safety and development of the vaccines in recent months.

US Secretary of State Mike Pompeo has called on the World Health Organization (WHO) to investigate the Wuhan Institute of Virology's (WIV) ties to the Chinese Communist Party (CCP) military and its research on viruses similar to COVID-19. Pompeo believes that understanding the origins of the virus could prevent future outbreaks and lead to better treatments or vaccines.

Comparing the efficacy of different COVID-19 vaccines is misleading as all vaccines listed are nearly 100% effective in preventing hospitalizations and death. It is recommended to get whichever vaccine is available.
Biden will allow more healthcare professionals and students, including dentists, midwives, paramedics, and veterinarians, to administer Covid-19 vaccines.
India has sent COVID-19 vaccines to Jamaica, which were made in India.

Conservatives voted against legislation that would provide funding for long-term care facilities, support for low and middle-income families, COVID-19 treatment and vaccines, and support for small businesses after three months of delay tactics.

India's VaccineMaitri initiative is providing free COVID-19 vaccines to friendly neighbouring and far away countries on humanitarian grounds, including Brazil, Morocco, and South Africa. This act of Vaccine Diplomacy is healing humanity and has received gratitude from around the world.
The vaccines are highly effective at preventing death and transmission of COVID-19. Doubt about the vaccines discourages people from getting vaccinated and prolongs the pandemic.
